alert.note: Alert for Latah (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued June 10 at 9:29PM MDT by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT THROUGH MONDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Portions of North Idaho, including the following counties, Benewah and Latah. Portions of Southeast Washington, including the following county, Whitman. * WHEN...Through Monday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Moderate to heavy rain will develop Friday evening and continue into Saturday morning bringing the potential for up to an inch of rainfall. Scattered showers and thunderstorms will continue on Saturday afternoon with locally heavy downpours. Another round of moderate to heavy rainfall will arrive late Sunday into Monday. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
